figgy.title: Resources updated in Pulfalight should update their metadata in Figgy automatically.

comments.body:
endpoint `/resources/refresh_remote_metadata` expects a body like `{ source_metadata_identifiers: [...] }` or `{ archival_collection_codes: [...] }`. For this ticket implement the code path for `archival_collection_codes`.

Implementation

- I get a list of things
- I kick of a job for each thing in the list
- That spawns a job per figgy resource that actually fetches the record/s from pulfalight
- See if metadata changed somehow before we persist to prevent needlessly re-preserving.
  - Note that the source metadata sync happens in the change set persister; we would have to compare up front somehow
- Use batches?
  - Would let us see the hierarchy of these jobs.

Example:

- I update C0001_c01 in ASpace
- Pulfalight hears that C001 changed.
- Pulfalight reindexes the full collection, because it has to, that’s how Pulfalight works.
- Pulfalight posts to figgy /resources/update_metadata with body { archival_collection_codes: [“C0001”] }
- Figgy hears the request, spawns a job for updating per collection code, returns “202 Accepted”.
  - queue low priority
- That job gets all resources which have that archival collection code, and spawns a metadata refresh job for each of those resources.
- The metadata refresh job should try to update, if nothing changes then don’t persist.
  - This metadata refresh job should be in the low priority queue.
- How many jobs per metadata update?
  - End up with one job per resource to be updated.

comments.body: @sdellis On submit there wasn't any message to users, since the JS wasn't set up to activate the Rails UJS form. I added a commit to do that: https://github.com/pulibrary/pulfalight/pull/1033/commits/ce0e360c55eb51de5b2ddef4de8ad506cb400bdd
Thanks, @tpendragon !
Message for suggest a correction/report harmful language is here: https://github.com/pulibrary/pulfalight/issues/1025.
We need to get approval for this from the product owners before this can be merged. @ccleeton @faithc

Auto reply response to Ask a Question

“Thank you for submitting your question to Special Collections. Someone will reply to you via email soon. We appreciate your patience and look forward to addressing your inquiry.”

These are the confirmation messages for each of the feedback forms. We will need updated language for each. Suggest a Correction and Harmful Language submissions go to the same LibAnswers queue but have different subjects so it it will be easy to tell them apart.
We got confirmation that we can get this in and adjust the layout of it in response to feedback from leadership.
I'm having a hard time replicating this, but the timeline does seem to fit with the deploy of #1028.

Mandy and Will did some more digging. It looks like this happens when you request two folders in the same box.

I think we need to add a grouping: first entry for the Site field.
Transaction 333225 is another example. This request was put in yesterday at about 3:30. I will also add that within the Aeon client we can not change the location ourselves.
Emails fail from both environments.
